form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES
form.official-title: To amend the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act to establish a private right of action for injuries caused by pesticides, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Pesticide Injury Accountability Act of 2025.

section.header: Private right of action for injuries caused by pesticides
section.text: The Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act (7 U.S.C. 136 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating sections 34 and 35 (7 U.S.C. 136x, 136y) as sections 35 and 36, respectively; and
by inserting after section 33 (7 U.S.C. 136w–8) the following:

section.header: Private right of action for injuries caused by pesticides

subsection.text: Any person the property or person of which is injured by a pesticide may bring a civil action in Federal district court against a registrant of the pesticide for monetary damages for injury to the property or person caused by the pesticide.
Monetary damages that may be recovered in a civil action under subsection (a)—

paragraph.text: include compensatory and punitive damages, at the discretion of the court; and
do not include attorney's fees or court costs.

subsection.text: Nothing in this section shall preempt any State law claim.
